Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I have developed speaking, writing, reading and listening skills in German by taking this course. I also learned new vocabularies and grammatical rules. This course has allowed me to practice both conversational and written German, which I found really helpful.
Ability to use adjectives in German, use of genitive case to show possession, conversational German, learned a lot about the culture of Germany and German speaking countries.
Strengths: Course is very good immersing you in German, teaching you about German culture in addition to just the language
I would recommend this course for the content that it teaches, and if there werent so many problems with the cultural exchange activities.

Yes, it's a great step in learning German. I felt like I learned a LOT more in L2 German than in L1, because by this point you know the basics of grammar and syntax and are able to apply them in actually speaking and writing German.
Yes, I'm a huge fan of the German Department's work. Best foreign language to take at Yale!
